text: Robert Churchwell (born February 20, 1972 in South Bend, Indiana) is a retired American basketball player. He played collegiately for the Georgetown University. A 6'6" (1.98 cm) 195 lb (89 kg) guard/forward, he played 4 games for the National Basketball Association's Golden State Warriors in the 1995–96 season. On June 14, 1994 Chris Devine of the Chicago based company Major Broadcasting purchased the Wichita Falls Texans, a Continental Basketball Association (CBA) team in Wichita Falls, Texas. The team was moved to Chicago and renamed the "Rockers". During the 1994 CBA draft the Rockers had the eighth pick out of 16 teams. The Rockers selected Derrick Phelps from the University of North Carolina, Deon Thomas from the University of Illinois, Robert Churchwell from Georgetown University, Shon Tarver from the University of California–Los Angeles, and Kenny Williams from the University of Illinois–Chicago, respectively.[7] The Rockers made the 1995 CBA playoffs with a 28–28 record. During the first round, Chicago defeated the Quad City Thunder in a five-game series.[18] Chicago faced the Pittsburgh Piranhas in the American Conference Finals. Pittsburgh swept Chicago three games to zero in a best-of five series. On March 12, 1996 the Chicago Rockers announced they were moving to La Crosse, Wisconsin after the 1995–96 season. The team reached an agreement to play at the La Crosse Center, paying one year's rent in advance. They would later become known as the La Crosse Bobcats. He is currently a Physical Education teacher at Salem Church middle school. == References == * Category:1972 births Category:Living people Category:Basketball players from Indiana Category:Chicago Rockers players Category:Florida Beachdogs players Category:Georgetown Hoyas men's basketball players Category:Golden State Warriors players Category:Gonzaga College High School alumni Category:La Crosse Bobcats players Category:SeaHorses Mikawa players Category:Sportspeople from South Bend, Indiana Category:Shooting guards Category:Small forwards Category:Undrafted National Basketball Association players Category:American men's basketball players
title: Robert Churchwell
